body.p: This deliverable represents the maps that will be used to generate the final HTML deliverable for Maps A and B.

Both maps include the other map as a peer in the maps as authored. For the deliverable-specific maps, the peer map references are replaced with local-scope map references to maps that contain new versions of the key definitions from the included peer map, rewritten to reflect the locations of those resources as delivered.
For example, the original key definition in Map B for topic topic-b-01.dita is: <keydef keys="topic-b-01" href="../topics/topic-b-01.dita"/>
The rewritten keydef looks like this: <keydef keys="topic-b-01" href="../map-b/topics/topic-b-01.html" scope="external" format="html" />

Note that you can only know that the @href value should be once Map B has been rendered for this delivery. In practice this means that each map must be rendered twice: once to determine the output location of key defined for that map and once to reflect the deliverable-specific key definitions for each peer map.
